SENT.plain: Sudden cardiac death (SCD) is an uncommon but devastating potential consequence of participation in competitive sport
It is seen in adolescent and young adult athletes
The most common cause of this, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), is a genetic disorder responsible for more than a third of cases and is manageable
Screening is undertaken for HCM, using differing strategies in Europe and North America
Screening and early diagnosis have reduced the mortality rate but has come at a significant economic cost
The evidence and relevant arguments for and against screening are presented together with management strategies as reflected by an illustrative case
